modules.title: Use of Free Energy in Chemical Equilibrium

summary: Engineering Chemistry is a comprehensive course designed to build strong foundational knowledge in this important area. This subject covers 6 key modules that progressively develop your understanding. You'll gain both theoretical insights and practical skills through lectures and assignments. The course prepares you for advanced studies and professional applications. Mastering this subject will significantly contribute to your academic and career success.
recommended_books: A Text Book of Physical Chemistry – KK Sharma and LK Sharma
Physical Chemistry – Peter Atkins and Julio de Paula
Organic Chemistry: Structure and Function – Volhardt & Schore
Fundamentals of Molecular Spectroscopy – C.N. Banwell
A.S. Negi and S.C. Anand – Physical Chemistry
course_outcomes: Describe atomic and molecular structure in terms of wave functions and represent energy levels via spectroscopic methods.
Interpret periodic variation of elemental properties and deduce quantitative information about heat engines.
Establish molecular orbital diagrams and relate electrochemistry to thermodynamics.
Relate empirical rate constants to molecular processes and evaluate experiments in chemical equilibria and kinetics.
Develop knowledge of fundamental properties of organic compounds and analyze changes in orbital energy levels in coordination compounds.
